title: Ofcom head’s bicycle crash delays choice of new leader
text:
The race to become the new chief executive of Ofcom has been delayed after the chairman of Britain’s media and telecoms watchdog suffered a painful bicycle accident.

Baron Terry Burns of Pitshanger was laid up with broken bones following the accident.

The 75-year-old, a keen cyclist and former chief economic adviser to the Treasury, has now returned to work at Ofcom, however. The appointment of a replacement for departing chief executive Sharon White is a top priority as the clock ticks down on her tenure.

The competition to succeed Ms White, who is leaving early next year to become chairman of the John Lewis Partnership, has attracted candidates from inside and outside the regulator.
